data.title: Great coffee, needs better hours
data.text: Love the coffee and the vibe but the hours are inconvenient IMO...also, not open on Sundays? That's the best day to grab coffee and catch up with friends

data.title: Great Staff
data.text: Enjoyed an early Saturday morning trip here for coffee and breakfast.  Great Quiche and very good coffee.  Service was excellent.  Would highly recommend if staying in the downtown area near the convention facility

data.title: Best of Breed Coffee Shop
data.text: Probably the best Cafe Americano I've ever had. Deep and rich, with no hint of bitter.   Good is incredible, amazing French Toast and a delightful chorizo dish.

data.title: Great place for millenials!  (and older folks like me)
data.text: I had never been to Fortezza before so this review is based on a one-time experience.  I ordered the special, a tomato bisque soup and grilled cheese sandwich plus a mocha.  The mocha was great, served with a decorative whipped cream feather on top.  The soup was tasty and the sandwich served on homemade cranberry bread, not your ordinary grilled cheese.  The atmosphere is comfortable with WiFi available and in use at several tables.  My friend and I had an enjoyable experience there on a cold afternoon in downtown Fort Wayne.  I think it is a bit pricey for what you get, and you cannot park in front of the restaurant.  You must park on a side street and walk a bit.  However, I would go back for another coffee or a cup of tea or brunch another day.

data.title: Overhyped coffee
data.text: The atmosphere is clean a d modern while still being cozy in a very old building. We both ordered different drinks and while the presentation was good the price was not and they both lacked flavor. I wasn't thrilled either when my boyfriend was told there was a 50 cent charge for ICE to be put in his drink....really? Is your product really that deep? No its not.

data.title: Best Coffee Shop in Fort Wayne
data.text:
Espresso Bar: 10/10
Pour-overs: 9/10
Pastries: 9/10
Breakfasts: 10/10

Fortezza features an outstanding espresso bar that highly regarded. Alton Brown recently listed Fortezza as his top (and only) recommendation in the state of Indiana. They use a Modbar equipment which produces tremendous consistency and control. One fairly unique drink is the Matcha Latte. In addition to their other standard drinks, they also create multiple holiday menus each year. These menus are always fun and are several steps above the specialty drinks you might see at other mainstream coffee shops.

The use Counter Culture beans. They serve wonderful pour-overs but I don't think they featured to the same degree as the espresso bar. It's possible that they could rework their counter space to boost their popularity.

I've had many of their pastries and all are delicious; but, if you have time to spare, it's worth ordering a full breakfast. The french toast might be the best I've ever had. 

They also serve several teas, Debrand chocolates, and a few other miscellaneous items. 

The location is great - very close proximity to the convention center, hotels, the Embassy, and the shopping on Wayne Street. 

They have a semi private room in the back that can be reserved.

data.title: Great spot for morning coffee
data.text: Stopped for the first time and really liked the place. Loved the seating facing the street-reminded me of a place in a much larger city I used to visit. The breakfast sandwich offerings looked tempting, but opted for a simple scone and coffee. The scones were very tasty, and the coffee was fine. I would love to come back again.

data.title: Great Food Items
data.text:
My daughter wanted me to try this place.   I ordered the Chorizo Sandwich.   This place is amazing and Unique.  Cortney tried the quiche and loved it.   Place is so good she came the day before "without me" and had the Cream Brûlée French Toast. 

She's becoming a food critic.

data.title: Real cups
data.text:
This place was well appointed with plenty of crockery.
The coffee was not as good as I expected, there was an overtaste of a unidentified type.
It was not as good as I expected

data.title: Best in Fort Wayne
data.text: I stop in 3-4 times per week and feel comfortable saying it's the best option in the city (in terms of quality). The location is great but I think they should consider a location on the south side as well.

data.title: Good coffee
data.text: The coffee at Fortezza is good. The internet is not that great, this is important to me since I go to coffee shops to get some work done as well.

data.title: Great coffee and environment
data.text: This place has a great environment for doing business or having conversations with friends. They also have a room for larger groups that can be used.

data.title: Tasty Coffee
data.text: Their coffee is prepared uniquely and it works. It is tailored to those who really appreciate good coffee.  Cups are smaller than the coffee chains..remember that when choosing your size.  Service is at a counter and limited food is available.

data.title: Nice addition to downtown
data.text:
A really nice addition to the downtown area.  The only fault I have of this new place is the parking issue.  Feed a meter or pay to park in the parking garage.  No on site free parking for here.
  Everything else that I have to say is very positive.  My "spot" is the seating area that over looks Calhoun Street.  I like that the windows have tint so I can better people watch.
   Price are very fair and the coffee selection is huge.  They do offer food here, but I have not tried any yet.  Pretty cool little shop.
